textEN: A variable is a container for storing data.
A function is a block of code designed to perform a task.
JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted programming language.
An array is a special variable that can hold more than one value at a time.
A loop is used to run the same block of code repeatedly under certain conditions.
An object is a collection of properties, and a property is an association between a name and a value.
The 'if' statement is used to make decisions in code.
The 'for' loop repeats a block of code a known number of times.
The 'while' loop repeats code as long as a condition is true.
The 'return' statement ends function execution and specifies a value to be returned.
The 'const' keyword declares a constant variable that cannot be reassigned.
The 'let' keyword allows you to declare a block-scoped variable.
The '===' operator checks both value and type for equality.
A callback function is a function passed into another function as an argument.
The 'typeof' operator returns the data type of a variable.
A promise is an object representing the eventual completion or failure of an asynchronous operation.
Asynchronous code allows tasks to run in the background without blocking the main thread.
The DOM (Document Object Model) represents the structure of an HTML document.
APIs allow applications to communicate with each other.
Debugging is the process of finding and fixing errors in your code.
